stories.text:
I got a series of emails from Microsoft to a slightly misspelled address (firstlast@gmail instead of first.last@gmail)

Email 1) Cofirm your email address Email 2) Your account has been renamed Email 3) Your account has been activated Email 4) Game purchase order

It seems my email haven't been breached (I have 2fa and got no prompt). My Microsoft account first.last@gmail doesn't show any activity. I haven't been charged anything.

The credit card used in the purchase order doesn't match any of my cards.

I have contacted Microsoft Support and only got to the first level support who were able to confirm that the emails are legit from Microsoft (based on headers, domains and signatures) but were unable to tell anything about the order / account itself.

I wonder what has happened and whether I should be worried.
stories.title: Ask HN: Emails from MS about account with almost my address. What happened?

stories.text:
Let us gather in root comments some annoying things in browsers which in theory might be disabled (by implementing extra switches in settings or by removing/adding some code with further compiling on user-side).

If you are in the browser developing and you understand what regular people can not understand, second level of comments is for criticism of why it is not possible or maybe for answers that it is possible with <something easy>. Please share annoyances which are applicable only to both of browsers (FF+Chrome). My opinion will be in one of root comments, please sorry that my question is about desktop browsers only, I just don't want to know that surfing from either mobile browser or from single-website-app does exist.
stories.title: Ask HN: What desktop browser's features/abilities/standards needs to be offable?
